citation.article-title: Carnimonas nigrificans gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterial causative agent for black spot formation on cured meat products.

p.s: Carnimonas (Car.ni'mo.nas. L. gen. n. carnis of meat; Gr. n. monas a unit, monad)
Non-spore-forming, Gram-negative, straight or slightly curved rod, occurring singly or as pairs, non-motile, oxidase and catalase activity positive.
Cells are obligately aerobic and slightly or moderate halophile.
No growth occurs in the presence of more than 8% NaCl.
The main component of respiratory quinones is ubiquinone 9.
The main components in the polar lipid composition are diphosphatidylglycerine, phosphatidylglycerine and phosphatidylethanolamine.
The major fatty acids are 16:0, 16:1, 18:1 plus 19cyc.
The type species is Carnimonas nigrificans.
